answers.answer: Dear snaphook,I would recommend that you seek help immediately, even an emergency room.  A new onset of double vision may indicate a number of conditions including TIA, transient ischemic attack, or a mini-stroke, thyroid eye disease, diabetes, abnormality in blood vessels of the brain or eye, diseases such as multiple sclerosis although without a complete history and physical a diagnosis can not be made.  I don’t want to scare you further, but it warrants an immediate visit to your doctor and a workup.Dr. FeldmanSandy T. Feldman, M.D., M.S.ClearView Eye and Laser Medical CenterSan Diego, California

question: Hi,I was driving home from work today and suddenly my eyes wouldn't focus together. i could put a hand over one eye or the other and see perfectly but saw double with both eyes open.I pulled off the road and in 3 -4 minutes it cleared.I am on a low dosage blood pressure medicine.What could cause this problem? Needless to say it scared the heck out of me.Thanks,Ben
title: Eyes Sudenly lost focus
